amendatorysection.para: Upon a motion by a party or upon the court's own motion, if the court finds during a hearing pursuant to section 42-1303 that a person is knowingly isolating the resident from visitation by a family member, the court may order such person to pay court costs and reasonable attorneyâ€™s fees of the petitioner and may order other appropriate remedies. No costs, fees, or other sanctions may be paid from the resident's finances or estate.
